newsitem.title: USA: Summit Medical names interim chairman.
newsitem.headline: Summit Medical names interim chairman.

text.p: Summit Medical Systems Inc said Wednesday that its board of directors appointed W. Hudson Connery Jr., an outside director of the company, as interim chairman of the board.

Last week, Summit said 1996 revenues would be "substantially less" than the $19.5 million originally reported because of accounting discrepancies discovered by its new chief financial officer, who resigned after less than a week on the job.
Edward Sweeney, the former chairman, will remain a member of the company's board, the medical information systems company said.

Summit Medical also said that it plans to hire an interim chief financial officer who will report directly to the interim chairman with respect to Securities and Exchange Commission filings and financial statement restatements.

As interim chairman, Connery will oversee the preparation and filing of the company's Form 1O-K for 1996 and the anticipated restatement of the company's financial statements for certain prior periods, the company said.
